data.description: Cyberlimb Option. Plastic coating for Cyberlimb. Available in wide variety of colors and patterns. Requires a Cyberarm or Cyberleg but does not take an Option Slot.
Thin webbing between toes. Negates movement penalty when swimming. Requires Two Cyberlegs and must be paired.
Inline skates built into feet. Can be concealed. Increases movement by 6m/yds when using Run Action. Requires two Cyberlegs and must be paired.
Cyberlimb Option. Artificial skin coating for Cyberlimb. Requires a Cyberarm or Cyberleg but does not take an Option Slot.
Cyberleg Option. Feet are coated with state-of-the-art traction material. The user negates the normal movement penalty for climbing. Requires two Cyberlegs and must be paired.
Cyberlimb Option. Shiny metallic coating for Cyberlimb. +2 to Wardrobe and Style. This bonus only applies once. Requires a Cyberarm or Cyberleg but does not take an Option Slot.

Replacement leg. Does not have to be paired. A Cyberleg has 3 Option Slots for Cyberleg or Cyberlimb Options and each comes pre-installed with a Standard Foot that doesn't cost any Humanity Loss or take up a Cyberleg Option Slot. Most Cyberleg options must be paired to work properly (purchased twice and installed in two different Cyberlegs on a user. Humanity Loss is calculated separately for each purchase).
Blade mounted in foot. Light Melee Weapon. Can be concealed without a Check. Can be installed as the only piece of Cyberware in a meat leg.
Resembles a normal foot. If installed into a meat leg, a Standard Foot doesn't count towards the number of pieces of cyberware installed in a meat leg. Doesn't take up a Cyberleg Option Slot.
Cyberlimb Option. Cyberlimb and installed options cannot be rendered inoperable by EMP effects, like Microwaver pulses, or Non-Black ICE Program effects. Requires Cyberarm or Cyberleg.
Hydraulics in legs. Negates movement penalty when jumping. Requires two Cyberlegs, takes up 2 Option Slots, and must be paired.
